snippet: The fund projects worldwide growth of about 3.3 percent this year and 4 percent in 2014; that is a reduction of 0.2 percentage points since January for this year’s figures, and is unchanged for 2014.
abstract: International Monetary Fund lowers its estimates for global economic growth in 2013; projects worldwide growth of 3.3 percent for the year and 4 percent in 2014; report still underscores that financial conditions have improved markedly, in large part because of aggressive monetary easing undertaken by Federal Reserve, Bank of Japan and European Central Bank.
lead_paragraph: The fund projects worldwide growth of about 3.3 percent this year and 4 percent in 2014; that is a reduction of 0.2 percentage points since January for this year’s figures, and is unchanged for 2014.

headline.main: I.M.F. Lowers Estimates for Global Economic Growth for 2013
